review: Red Robin Royalty card - get one if you don't have one. Burgers are nearly always the best around. Big and cooked as I prefer. The seasonal specialty burgers are worth trying. Bottomless fries - seasoned exceptionally. Try the donut tower if available. Freckled lemonade - whether spiked or no - is quite the yum.

Horrible! This place has gone downhill... so sad. From the minute we walked in, until the minute we left~ dissatisfaction.  Under-staffed, rude customer service, incorrect orders, waiting, waiting, waiting... the restrooms a complete mess.  This used to be one of our favorites, unfortunately (well fortunate for us!)  we will not be returning for another lackluster experience.

Red Robin used to be the go to place with the kids. Went tonight for my sons birthday and it was by far the worst experience we had there. Received a pig out burger with no bacon, a burger with hair in it. The replacement burger was noticeably thrown together quickly and was terrible in appearance so we didn't want that one either. So my wife left hungry. My bottomless root beer floats came with warm root beer that melted the ice cream instantly. Waste of a night, waste of $100. Sorry for the crappy birthday dinner experience son, we will make it up to you.  Booooooooo Red Robin!

Red Robin is one of my favorite places to eat! However, our past 3-4 visits at this location we've had not so good service. It takes forever to order and get your drinks and when you order appetizers they don't come out until right before your food comes. Their never that busy either. A week ago I ordered a side salad and the Taco Tavern Double. The salad came out and about the second bite in, I noticed a hair. I went to pull it off and it was very long and disgusting. I did get a new salad but my appetite was ruined for the rest of the time. This is the second time I've gotten the Taco Tavern Double and it didn't have the crunchy tortilla strips on it. The meat was low quality also. I think I will find another place for burgers until I get my appetite back for this place!
Fuck this place. I'm 14 and 5'3" and I don't look very young and they gave me a little ass cup like wth mutha fucka
Good service, good food, good price. I love the Burnin' Love burger! I am never disappointed when I visit here. The pretzel bites are also delicious.

Stopping by this chain on a late Saturday afternoon has completely affirmed to me that this chain has completely sold out and lost it's soul.  Everything was of poor quality, and taste. Like we're talking, I should've just walked my butt down to McDonalds instead. Same quality of garbagey, chewy, burgers to ingest. The saddest part is that this chain didn't really start it's decline until the past few years. There was a time Red Robin was known for decent burgers.  The fries are just totally crappy, lifeless, and usually luke warm (if you're lucky).  I came here for a juicy, hot, cheesy, mind blowing burger, but I have so viciously fooled myself into thinking that this chain produced such quality, and I was left with complete and utter buyers regret, considering the amazing places we have here in Ohio for some beef.  Hell, just drive a few minutes up Trabue Rd to Johnnie's for some REAL meat.  I want my $50 back.  The dessert sucks, too. Don't bother.... All frozen, mildly warmed, and slathered with pathetic, wilting strawberries.  Just an outright shame.

I saw a 20% off coupon for take out orders on their website and decided to place an order. I went through the whole process and at the end of it, it forces you to enter a credit card to finish. I wanted to pay with cash, so I called it in. I told the woman on the phone (who was friendly) about the 20% off and she said they would take it off when I arrive and pay. When I get there, they send me to the bar to get my order. The bartender is obviously busy and I wait for a few minutes. When he gets to me, I tell him I have a take out order and that I want to use a coupon. He disregarded that and rang it up at normal price. I showed him the coupon on their website and he said that's only for people who have some kind of rewards card or something. I responded that it says nothing about that and it's just 20% off a take out order. He gets frustrated and has to get someone else, so I wait. When the next guy comes, he says he knows nothing about the coupon and didn't want to honor it, but after my persistence he finally re-rang it, but wouldn't take my money, so I waited some more. The bartender comes back to take my money. I hand him a large bill to which he says "If you want to pay with that, you'll have to give me some time because I don't have change." Ok, so I dug through my purse and found exact change.  I paid and he did say sorry about the coupon thing. After all this, I get home to cold food. I paid for extra guacamole which I did not get. There were no tortilla strips for my soup which are supposed to come with it. My NachO.M.G. which is basically chilli nachos barely had any chili. The jalepenos were sweet which was weird. There was no cilantro-as the description states. To top it off, I found a hair in my food. The food was not worth the money even with the discount and the staff has an overall air of being bothered or annoyed.
This is my favorite burger place!  Always great staff and food! I like the Red Robin rewards program, i'm always saving money.

One of the best Red Robin's I've ever been to! The service is excellent and the food is prepared well. The bottomless fries are amazing (recommend the sweet potato fries). Their burgers are unique and tasty!

Tonight we went for our sons birthday. He got the pig out tavern double, now the description of this sounded amazing since he loves bacon yet there was no bacon to be found on the burger. The burger I received had small blond hairs in it. They did replace the burger, this burger was burnt to a crisp, cheese was not melted what so ever, a pinch of lettuce and everything else just splatted on. I did not eat this burger either and left hungry, we stopped by Wendy's on the way home and my Jr. Deluxe cheeseburger which was $1.19 was great compared to what I was served at Red Robin. My husband got bottomless Root beer floats that came with hot root beer which melted his ice cream instantly. The manager stopped by our table and asked us if we needed a box, did not apologize for the hair in my food or anything. To top everything off we waited 25 minutes to be seated and walked past at least 15 empty clean tables. Our bill for 5 well 4 since mine was taken off was $100 with tip for food that was sub par. We could have gotten a better meal at Wendy's for less than $25.00 for all 5 of us.

Lost a little bit of the luster from days gone by.  Decent burger and good fries once I replaced the lukewarm order that came with the sandwich.  Would I stop again?- sure, but it's not a place that I would rave about and call my go-to burger source.

We got there, 2 pm on a Thursday, had to wait to be seated, then sat at our wet table for 20 minutes waiting for a server. So we left. They were not busy, but I noticed one server only was on duty. Big disappointment. We will never return.
Really enjoyed the customer service!!! The food could have been a little better. Just my opinion.

We come and eat lunch at this place two or three times a month and we've never been disappointed.This great hamburger place serves nothing but good food! Great choices but I especially love their cheeseburger, and endless fries and they also have gluten free options. They have a family friendly atmosphere with a good variety on the menu for children. The staff is friendly and helpful. Definitely worth the money.

Writing this review is painful. Cause I have to relive the misery I just went through for the past 18 hours.  My boyfriend and I went to red robin cause we wanted some "gourmet burgers". God, how could've I have been so stupid?  We got our food. I got a whiskey bbq burger and he got the bleu bbq burger.  I was up all night crapping myself and throwing up and praying that hell would be over soon. Yep, that's right. I got food poisoning. It was my first time getting it and god it was freaking awful.  I will never go back here ever again. I was warned too. Now you have been warned. Save yourself. Just don't do it. Please. For your health and sanity. Just don't.

We arrived at 3  p.m. to have a late lunch. There were lots of empty tables that needed to be cleared so we ended up waiting for 25 minutes for a table. We were a party of only 3. The floors were covered with disgusting smashed food which was really appetizing!  . The floors remained dirty the whole hour and a half we were there!  The waiter took his time bringing our drinks; at least 10 minutes. We ordered an onion ring tower which arrived fairly quickly but the waiter hadn't brought out any napkins, utensils or plates which we had to ask for. Of course it took another 5+ minutes to bring those out so we could eat. Our burgers were delicious and hot but we were NEVER asked if we wanted fry refills by the waiter. We had to ask several times!  We placed our empty water glasses at the end of the table in hope that he would see our glasses were empty. No such luck. I had to flag him down and ask for more water. . Apparently they were short staffed but the Manager should've stepped in to sweep floors and bus tables instead of just walking around looking at her iPad. We won't be back even though we used to love this place. NEED NEW MANAGEMENT SOON!!

Got home last night and the first thing my wife says is "I want a burger for dinner" Not Hello Honey or How was your day? This told me she had been through a long day and needed some comfort food. We talked about going to a few other places but quickly settled on Red Robin, as we had always had a decent experience there. We walked in and were seated right away in the bar area, which was fine. Our waitress appeared after a minute or two, with a trainee in tow. She took our drinks order and then was soon back to take our food order. My wife had a basic burger with fries and I ordered the Guacamole & Bacon Burger, also with fries. We had not been to a Red Robin for about 6-9 months and noticed they now had these tablets sitting on the table. They are loaded with games, information and more. Before we received our food, our waitress came bye and explained how to use the tablet in full. Not only does it let you play games, but it also let's you sign up for their birthday club, will allow you to pay for your meal if using a credit card and most importantly, will let you leave feedback on your dining experience. Our waitress told us about this particular feature 3 different times during our visit, requesting we give her a "10" rating each time.  When our food arrived, my wife's burger was fine, but mine was missing the guacamole. We asked a passing manager why the guacamole and bacon burger had no quac and he was  shocked but quickly went back into the kitchen to get some. Of course, even though he was quick, the burger was now growing cold, as was our feelings about the feedback we were going to leave. We've eaten at this same restaurant about 3 times now and until this meal, never really had any complaints, but we also were never blown away by any of the food. Between the multiple requests for a great rating from our waitress and the burger without guacamole, it will probably be a while before we go back. it used to be that a wait staff would be tipped well if they provided great service, but last night we wondered if being given a good review was more important? My advice to Red Robin, take away the tablets, take away the server reviews and let the wait staff worry about the customers, not their ratings.

Ordered take out tonight (4-1-17) and when I got home my wife and I noticed our burgers were undercooked ( blood dripping from burger onto French fries). Drove all the way back to the restaurant to return food and get properly cooked burgers. I have a seat at the bar and have a beer as I wait for our sandwiches to be recooked. Manager comes out and asked what happened and I simply say "your cook served us raw meat." His response is " is someone getting you taken care of?" And my reply was yes. He said he would bring my order out when it was done. When he finally brought out our food he says "you don't owe us anything"............. WTF!!! I'm not one looking for a hand out, but when you serve my wife and I raw burger and I have to drive back to the restaurant to have it corrected, they should have at least bought my beer as I waited for them to refire our burgers. I cannot believe the manager said "you don't owe us anything". This is not the first time we have had problems with take out from the Red Robin on Hilliard -Rome.

Fantastic grilled chicken sandwich! My kids enjoyed the bottomless mac and cheese. Was disappointed to be charged $1.95 entertainment fee for using the game kiosk at our table. Server was very attentive and professional. Service was quick!
Red Robin is one of my favorite restaurants and this locations is one of the best. The servers always have a smile on their face and are kind.

Food is usually decent, but last couple times there we have had to wait an extraordinarily long time to get our food. Also have had to wait with empty drinks for extended periods of time for servers come back around. Overall poor service.

This is a difficult review to write. My rating has changed over time from very good to below expectations. The complaints that I have now are mostly situational related to our local restaurant and perhaps not indicative of the experience you will have at a different location.  Let me start with the good: we have always been happy with the menu and the food. My wife gets a salad with lite dressing, I substitute sweet potato fries. I like the turkey burger, my wife usually likes one of their fancy options and often customizes. The fare is simple, but has always been prepared well and we often look forward to what we are getting. Put simply, the food is good. The bad part is the management of the restaurant and the service. A few years back, we would go at least once a month because we always got seated quickly and the service was fast, friendly, and efficient. Lately, they've gone completely down-hill. Over the last three visits we have had consistent problems 1) getting seated quickly, 2) getting a server to acknowledge us in a reasonable time after being seated, and 3) getting our food to our table in a time frame comparable to previous experiences.  The first of our last three visits, I had to flag down the manager after 10 minutes sitting at our table without a server. She dealt with it well, but it made the whole experience not enjoyable. The second of our last three visits, our service was slow and then we had to wait an extra 15-20 minutes at the end to get our check dealt with because our server lost my credit card. It took half that time for the manager to acknowledge that there was a problem and she made no effort to push to a resolution, instead leaving quickly to go back and expedite orders. Eventually, another server found my card and the manager decided to comp our meal, but it was a complete customer service disaster. This most recent visit, we waited between 5-10 minutes after being seated to be acknowledged by our server. I meant to time the whole visit but forgot until I got frustrated with the delay. I did start the time late when our server finally acknowledged us and from then until the time our food hit the table it took 42 minutes. That is not an acceptable wait for this type of restaurant. To top everything off, they have switched to using the Ziosk devices on the table now. My wife noticed they had trivia on it and so she started playing. It wasn't until we were reviewing the bill that we realized that the stupid thing charged us $2.00 for the short time we spent playing trivia. It does tell you it is going to charge money, but the workflow is very misleading and easy to mess up. If you have a kid or a toddler, keep them completely away from the stupid thing unless you want to pay the extra money.

Service is always just, "ok."  It is my understanding that this restaurant is a training restaurant, so I usually let it go when the service is bad.  The food is always good, with the exception of cold sweet potato fries every time we order them.  We always send them back, and they always give us new ones.  The kids menu is great and we enjoy their burger selection.  We will continue to go back, but never with high expectations of service.

I have never had a bad experience here. I recommend the whiskey river chicken sandwich, the fry seasoning, and of course, CAMPFIRE SAUCE!!don't know what all is in there but it's great.  The food has always been fresh, atmosphere clean and comfy, and service superb!  I  would encourage anyone to go and give it a try. They have something for everyone , and all you can eat fries!
I've always thought that this chain goes highly unnoticed as far as the quality of their food is concerned. Great menu selection, fair prices and bottomless French fries!!! It's a win-win situation!!
It was ok. My daughter has celiac disease and they offer a gluten-free children's menu. Other than that I don't think I would come back.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars, but Yelp won't let me. Don't go there after 9pm. I just sat in this @&$thole in Hilliard for 15 minutes after getting seated and didn't even get a drinks order. They were all too busy pretend cleaning the floors, tables, and rip off tablet screens to do any real work. @$ck this place. We spend over $60 each time we go there with the whole family, so we left and went down the street to Applebee's. They were happy to seat us, get drinks,and take our orders. Crazy stuff for a restaurant. Won't ever spend money at Red Robin in Hilliard again.

Looking to watch your cholesterol a bit?  Don't overlook the turkey burger.  Enormous flavor! Of course kids love this place, but really it is for kids of all ages (including me!)  I'll never turn down a Banzai Burger

In Columbus for a business trip and the group decided on Red Robin.  One thing that I need to get use to when I travel is eating at branded restaurants.  In Vegas, most of the Yelpers eat at locally owned restaurants or one of a kind type joints.  Oh well, I will follow the group and see what happens.  I've been to Red Robin a handful of times, usually for their Turkey Burger and bottomless steak fries.  Yes, I love me some steak fries.  At this Red Robin, I was undecided and I know they are known for their burgers.  I held off a burger because I was having Bachi in a couple of days.  The waitress arrived and I was still undecided.  I freaked out with the pressure of being undecided that I ended up choosing their Nantucket Seafood Scatter.  This consisted of battered cod, fried shrimp, clam strips, and fries.  The food was okay, but to be honest I couldn't tell the difference between the cod, fried shrimp, and clam strips. Everything was covered in batter that it was just that what I tasted could remember, just the batter.  The fries were good like always and they are endless.   When it comes to a Red Robin, there's something for everyone.  Everyone that loves bad for you food that is.  Next time, if there's a next time, I'm at Red Robin I'm going to stick to what I know is good and okay for you...their Turkey Burger.   PS:  Their chili is back on the menu.  Been a long time, but it's some of the best chili you'll find out there.
Queued for twenty minutes and the restaurant was half empty the food is ok but the service leaves a lot to be desired.  If you can go elsewhere.

I think this is one of those love it or hate it places. I'm a burger guy so I tend to lean toward the love side.  That said, I do generally recommend their basic/classic burgers. I think sometimes they get a little over zealous with their "gourmet" burgers and while in theory and on paper it sounds good, the end result is a bit of a flop, to my taste buds at least.  Bottomless fries are great now that Ruby Tuesday's have all but disappeared from most of the area however if they'd give you more from the get go you wouldn't have to go bottomless, kind of like a good date. Give it to me all NOW and I won't nag you for it 5 times in a row all 15 minutes apart.  Good place to hang with some friends, grab dinner, and B.S. for a while. Go Red Robin. Love your TV commercial jingle too.

Food was great but service was ridiculous slow. In fairness it was kinda busy with a few large parties so staff was focusing on them. Asked couple of times for update on progress with no results. Our server was on his own time schedule not ours. Took 10 minutes to get check from the time I asked for it. Won't be back in foreseeable future.

First time eating RR, but I am already happy about the service. Got our order to go and was given 2 free drinks while we waited, very kind of the bartender. Food was really good, I will be back again, thanks for a great experience

This is a a very family friendly place with good burger options.   We have been going there since our kids were small and the servers have always been kind and friendly to them.   I like their Bonzi Burger the best.

Service was good. Fries were cold. Onion rings fabulous. Store was slow so I was surprised that my booth seat was dirty.  Had the peach iced tea, it's really good.  The southern charm burger was good. Had a sweet bbq taste with brown sugar bacon and cheese. It was juicy and hit the spot. The servers were very accommodating and friendly. I would come again.  It's in a good location near shopping on a main road. Try it it's better than going to the golden arches or the red haired girl.

This place is good, the reason i rated it a 3 is the prices seem high for burgers. You do get unlimited fries which is kinda cool.  There is nothing to special about Red Robin that makes the prices worth the food. I mean a burger is a burger, minus fast food joints. But for a burger fries and drink to run you $10+ is kinda mind boggling. Its not like they use secret ingredients.  If you want a expensive burger this is the place to go. You can get the same quality at Steak n Shake, Applebees, etc, which a number of them will resemble Red Robins prices.  Good but for me not cost efficient by any means.

Meh, this place was ok. I've never been to one before and I can't say I'll go back. The burger was good but I've had much better in this area. What was absolutely disgusting was watching the bus boy walk across the restaurant licking his fingers and then cleaning off a table.

Love this restaurant. Burgers are always tasty and the fries are great. The staff- especially the bar area staff - recognizes the regulars and remembers their preferences. The only complaint os that the ventilation system is not great. My clothes smell like cooking everytime i go but not enough to not go. Highly recommended.

Have never been here and will be back! our server,David, was fabulous! best service we've had in a while. Chicken sandwich and burger was great! Birthday song was better! Don't get me started on the onion rings! OMG!

We asked for fries when we got our drinks and it was 20 min before we saw the first fry. When they arrived they were cold. When the main food came, the fries were hot. I love the grilled chicken caesar wrap! And my family ordered bacon cheese burgers and they said their food was good as well. I would come back simply because the food was good. Service on the other hand left something to seriously be desired!!!!!!!

Love the burgers- but that is about it! We took my cousin and her husband to RR-the staff was literally in the middle of a crisis... crying and threatening lawsuits to the cooks for the whole dining room to see. We asked our very good male server what was going on- and he apologized and admitted to not understanding- and that everyone was very emotional there. If your looking for a burger or chicken wrap- I can vouch - but beyond that- drive on by!

I'm so used to the Easton location, this place felt totally new, since the layout seems so much different.  For some reason Red Robin burgers are my favorite.  It's always good and I've never had anything bad here.

Red Robin is great when you just want a big ole messy burger and fries.  The fries are unlimited, and the burgers run the scale from your usual hamburger to chicken, salmon, turkey, or veggie, with a wide variety of toppings.  There is usually also a special burger featured for a limited time.  Not into burgers?  That's ok, there are also a variety of entrees.   My husband enjoys the Guacamole Bacon Burger in particular, while I go for a lettuce-wrapped Chicken Caprese - I just love the pesto sauce and fresh mozzerella.  The burgers are large, and I often end up cutting mine in half to enjoy the rest later.  The fries come out piping hot, crunchy, and delicious with a nice seasoning.   We do prefer to go at less peak days/times to avoid the large crowds, and the service is always quite good here when we go.
Whiskey River BBQ burger, I get it ever time I come here.

Went to the Red Robin in Hilliard I was in the mood for a burger  and some good fries .  I got the good burger not so much with the fries. Now if I'm going to eat out I'm going to do it up right. So I order them with garlic,  I tell the waiter I want some garlic on them,  not dry.  Well they come out DRY so I ask for a side of the garlic he brings that out along with another side of "garlic fries" the garlic was so scarce Dracula would have eaten them. And to boot it cost me an extra dollar! If I'm paying extra you better make it worth my while! It was a joke a while back instead of red robin yum......  It was red robin yuck and it's getting back to that.  I should have went to 5 guys and saved some money

3Stars..First..I am not happy with the redecorating.... Why would you take down all the great décor you had up??? That's what made RR great...especially the Carousel horses. Second service seemed a bit slow and my bacon cheeseburger came out without bacon!!! We also ordered the Chocolate Fruffles and I have to say I wasn't impressed. They had too much salt on them. And I would offer a Carmel dipping sauce instead of the whipped cream and the berry sauce needs to be thicker. Hoping our next visit will warrant more stars.

We in my nuclear family approve. High calorie. And fat. Burgers, fries, you know the drill. No complaining about this place - they've got it down. If you grew up in the USA, you have these meal in your DNA and will find fulfillment here.  What is fun, if you seek an experience more laced with enjoying the experience of life on this absurd planet, is that this is the "remedial" restaurant. It is as-if the focus group participants were unable to fathom a menu or ordering and required careful verbal direction. The staff at Red Robin is trained to deliver this treatment and listening to how they do that  is very enjoyable. I really want to go there and say "So, if I tell you I want something from this list of foods printed on this sheet of paper clad in plastic, that, even though we are not blood kin and i just walked in without an invite, you will make and bring it to me just in exchange for some money? Dang!"

Around my Birthday, this is one of my faves since I get a free burger. Even if this is a chain, I really enjoy their burgers.  I have only been disappointed once with coming here dozens of times.  The place is great for kids and now that I have a little one, I feel a little more normal here.  Their burgers can be a little expensive especially if you don't make use of their unlimited steak fries.   Last time here, I ordered the Banzai Burger with Pineapple and a teriyaki sauce.  I really enjoyed this burger as it was think and juicy with a wonderful flavor.  I would utilize the option to change the bun on the burger along with the order.  I ordered it on a jalapeno onion bun.  I also ordered it with southwest black beans instead of the fries, so i would say I spent a little too much but I had a gift card so I wasn't too worried.  I would order the Banzai, Royal Red Robin, the burger with Guac, or the whiskey burger and be happy here.  They have a good amount of choices and do pretty well with making a nice looking burger.  Once I did get sick from eating here, but that was many years ago.  I avoided the place for awhile but my free burger along with my wife's love of this place brought us back.  To sum it up:  Good burger that is great for kids, birthdays, and groups.
Great food. I had the Blue cheese burger and unlimited fries and soda. The burger was awsome and served hott. It was about $15.00 per person but well worth it . I will be back......five star...."...

This is the worst red robin we have been to.  The service is horrible.  Almost the entire restaurant was empty but tables were dirty.  35 minute wait.  This was at 1:30 on a friday.  The excuse was that they have only one person to bus table.  Waiters and waitresses standing around.  No sign of the manager.  Food came out cold, hamburgers sat on warmer and buns were too wet to eat, fries cold and not edible.  Bottomless fries,  couldn't eat first set of fries and waitress never returned. Seriously, skip this Red Robin and go elsewhere.  (Generally, I'm very easy to please).

Red Robin is great restaurant for families. It's very kid oriented and they also have very good food.  I love their fried mushrooms and they are known for their burgers.  My favorite is the basic bacon cheeseburger.  You also get bottomless fries with the burgers. They have plenty of good options on the kids menu and have balloons for the kiddies when you leave. A solid burger joint for those with, or without, kids.

We have been severely disappointed the last couple times we've been to Red Robin. We used to enjoy this restaurant because the food was good, it was reasonably priced, and it didn't take a long time. Now that we have a toddler, the length of time it takes to get food becomes even more important. My husband was so annoyed at the wait to take our order that he started a timer- I think it was over 26 minutes by the time we got our order in.  We also had issues with the machine on the table- the buttons are misleading so that while thinking I was playing a free trivia game (after all, I did not select "$1.99 play as many games as you want" as you want) I accepted charges without being aware of it (the "cancel" option is actually where the price seemed to be listed, upon further inspection after receiving a higher than expected bill). Perhaps it's technically my fault for not reading the fine print but no one likes to leave an establishment feeling like they've been taken advantage of. This really should be unacceptable anyway, especially with these devices within the reach of children and, to my observation, most frequently used by them. I was also disappointed to find that instead of taking my more expensive birthday burger off the bill, the billing system removed my husband's less expensive option. Ever since we started patronizing Red Robin they always took the more expensive burger off, regardless of who ordered it, and brought a little birthday sundae at the end of the meal. However, I can understand that this policy might have changed but the other two issues are frankly not forgivable. All of this is on top of previous visits with similar (or longer) wait times at the table and even worse, a waitress who lost our credit card when we tried to pay (which added another 50 minutes to our stay while she walked around aimlessly with absolutely no confidence that she was even looking for it, let alone had notified her manager and asked for assistance from team members). We will not be returning.

Ok, so we just got finished losing at the casino and really needed some food to prevent any hangovers the next day. Wow, was this a great choice. We got the pretzel bites to start which were pretty good, followed by a shot and some beer, followed by an amazing prime rib sandwich. They served it with au jus on the side, mmm loved dipping the sandwich and fries. They have a really good seasoning mix that you can add to burgers, fries, soup, ice cream. I mean it's really that good. Anyways, success on the food choice and no hangover the next day. Win!

One of my most favorite places to go. The whole family gets together on my birthday every year to feast. The food is always hot, the service is always friendly, & everything is delivered in a timely manner. I suggest the bacon cheeseburger with bacon aioli. So good with bottomless fries & campfire sauce. :)
I dont know...just average burgers. Nothing really jumps out at you. If youre going to be a "gourmet" burger joint, you need to be more edgy. All their "specialty" offerings seem boring. Not a fan.

This is a soft four, but didn't deserve a 3 star; above average looking burger, but it just doesn't call you back for more; steak fries were crisp; ate in the bar and the bartender was very attentive;

My favorite part of Red Robin is the unlimited fries! The entrees- burgers, chicken sandwiches, chicken tenders, salads, etc. are all tasty. Beware, though, the sandwiches get pretty messy.  The day I visited recently, the bathroom was kind of a mess. There were paper towels all over the floor and the counter was wet.  Other than the unpleasant bathroom, the food was good, the service was quick. It was a good experience, but I wouldn't say it blew me away. It was about what I expect from a burger chain.
This place is so much fun .. There drinks are great , onion ring tower and amazing burgers of course.. Don't forget the unlimited fries ..

We tried to have a quick lunch with 2 kids this afternoon. The waitress would ask us something, then disappear for 10-15 min at a time. She brought the wrong order to my 1 year old, never asked about drink refills, and took 15 minutes to bring back the check for my dad to sign. There were 4 other tables filled and our "quick lunch" took 1 hour and 15 minutes. We do not typically go out to eat, and after this experience will NEVER go back to red robin and will not recommend it to anyone.

I second the reviewer who said this particular Red Robin is top notch for the chain. I've never left here disappointed-- mostly because the staff is always attentive and perky. The last time I went, I was so impressed with our waitress, Keena, that I had to take the time to contact corporate and tell them what a great job she did. The food is at a very minimum good, and usually great. The royal robin is a fantastic burger, the fries are good, and those smoothie drinks are among the best I've had. My only complaint would be they seem to be a bit stingy with those so called bottomless fries. Don't get me wrong-- there's never any eye rolls about requests for refills of the fry basket.  But on a recent visit, we were starving and asked for our fries to come out before anything, and they brought a basket that was skimpy enough that we couldn't help but start counting them. But, oh well. Not a deal breaker.. just something I've noticed. My fry gluttony aside, I'd recommend this particular Red Robin in a heart beat.

The soup was cold, they comped it - but who serves cold soup? They were swamped, understaffed... a problem that many Columbus restaurants seem to have, without making up for it with servers who are trying to overcome the dearth. This it the third time I've been here with work people - the servers always seem like they are tired and wish they could be somewhere else.

I love Red Robin!   The service at this location is always great and this is one restaurant I can count on my 2yo behaving at.  It's definitely a family restaurant. But the food, the food is fantastic.  I love the burgers, chicken sandwiches and milkshakes.  My favorite is by far the California Chicken Sandwich, it has bacon and guacamole on it, yum.  But beware - sandwich, plus fries, plus milkshake runs you about 2300 calories.  How do I know this?  Because their website allows you to customize what you want to eat and then provides you the nutritional value (or lack of).  Another great perk, balloon on the way out the door!

I know its a chain, but i really think the Hilliard Rome store has a top notch burger. I can't speak as highly for the other franchises, but the Royal Robin is probably my favorite burger in Columbus.
Love red robin! Great burgers yummy fries and decent service. No complaints other than the wait. Lots of open tables but we still had a half hour wait.
really yummy food!  great burgers!! Service is always great!  I only stay away because of the calories....
Went on a Friday around 5:00pm. Just beat the crowd. The burgers were awesome, and the service was fast and attentive.

It's a Red Robin, they all taste the same.  The fiance & I don't like kids so much, but we like our burgers.  We try to go to RR later at night & avoid the kiddies.  We arrived around 9pm & were pleased to see few children in the restaurant.  Of course, we were seated directly next to a table of kids.  Fantastic.  The kid proceeded to lay on the bench next to me, crawl dangerously close to me, and drool next to my leg.  Even if I liked children, this would be traumatizing.  Of course the child's parents did nothing.   Hosts: when the restaurant is nearly empty, do NOT sit a couple without children anywhere near kids.  This allows them to enjoy an adult conversation and be free from drooling.
Poor service waited 40 minutes for burgers. Wrong sides. No water refill.

Very bad experience. They totally eliminated chili. No chili whatsoever. Ordered clam, shrimp, fish platter. The shrimp was literally raw where it curled, and the batter wasn't even cooked. They did not even offer to take the shrimp off the bill. I gave Red Robin another chance after a terrible experience in Canton, Ohio and we had two very positive visits. I even wrote that the nachos (with chili) were the best we ever had. Next visit, the chili is gone, the nachos were very dry and the shrimp was raw.  I'm not going to try Red Robin again. It's not worth the price to get good food that they clearly do not know how to prepare from a  Colorado based company that doesn't realize chili is a very popular item in Ohio.

Food is good, hot, and service is good. I don't have any negative comments. I do have a suggestion. If you're not a family person, like me, I'd go when they first open and before dinner - you will get a lot of noise from kids. What ever happened to the adults having control over their kids? I don't see much of that! YIKES
We come here about once a week,Not a bad place to eat,Sometimes our server isn't that good.

Well folks, I havent been to this Red Robin in years. Yeah, the RR is practically in my neighborhood and have driven by it a half cazillion times and stopped in there last night to have dinner with a friend of mine. Well you've got me hooked Red Robin!!! We both ordered burgers (duh!) and I had the 'Shroom Burger with the steak fries. It was good. The mushrooms were oozing out of the back of the bun and the burger itself didnt taste like it was dried out or undercooked. Just right. I'll give it two thumbs up!!! We will definitely be back again. I think I have my eye on the Whisky River BBQ burger!!!!! Ooh, and my mouth is watering as we speak!!! LOL!

This place is so hit and miss it isn't even funny.  Sometimes I can go in and get a great burger but more often than not my food is blah and I walk out regretting my choice.  I wish they were more consistent because the food can be great.

I mean if you're hungry and need a burger- you can't go wrong. This location has a nice patio and a great drink menu. On another trip, it was great to bring our toddler along as they hand out balloons and make a big deal over the kids.

The service has been consistently great. My favorites are the clam chowder and the teriyaki chicken sandwich. The bar in the middle of the restaurant seems a bit strange, but the food is par for the course. Nothing spectacular, but nothing awful, either.
I love the onion rings here! This time wasn't the best service wise, but I was still happy with my food! It really is awesome that they carry boca as well!!

Love me the Red Robin.  Towering stack of onion rings (arranged in size order, no less), check.  Unlimited steak fries, check.  Now, what do I want, the fish (always a good choice if you're burned out on burgers).  Do I want the chicken strips (clucks and fries), or the bacon burger?  One of those and a Coke, and you won't leave not completely stuffed.  Great atmosphere is yet another reason to come.  HAVE TO ding the rating because of the cost.  Wow.  Just dining alone and the bill easily hits $15, which is why I don't come as often as I would.  Otherwise a great casual date night.
One of the better Red Robin's in CBUS, but it's still just a fairly generic family resturant.  Be sure to order drinks at the bar and save yourself $1-$2 per drink.
